page.title: 02Pin Green Streets,Stevenage.
page.content: Stevenage has developed in blocks,the {Old Town}from Saxon times;the{New {Town}from 1959.The names of different areas come from the past.{Pin Green was named after Ralph de la Pende who lived in 1294.{Martins Wood}was named after a wood in the north- east;next to it is a field called the Round Diamonds which is now a school's name.The{St. Nicholas}area takes its name from the church. {Roads in Pin Green}have famous sportsmen's names,e.g.Webb Rise,Archer Road.In{Martin's Wood}we have race- courses e.g.Ascot Crescent;while Cathedrals give their names to some {St. Nicholas}roads,and industrial inventors are remembered on the {factory site},with Wedgwood Way and other names.
